unnormalised: ## Ditch the Cassettes, Embrace the Stream: Music is Everywhere Now, Yaar!
normalised: ## Ditch the Cassettes, Embrace the Stream: Music is Everywhere Now, Friend!

unnormalised: Remember those days of painstakingly recording songs off the radio onto cassettes? Or arguing with your sibling about whose turn it was to play their favourite Bollywood track on the family’s ancient Philips stereo? Ah, nostalgia! But honestly, who misses rewinding tapes with a pencil?
normalised: Remember those days of painstakingly recording songs off the radio onto cassettes? Or arguing with your sibling about whose turn it was to play their favourite Bollywood track on the family’s ancient Philips stereo? Ah, nostalgia! But honestly, who misses rewinding tapes with a pencil?

unnormalised: Thankfully, those days are long gone. We live in the age of music streaming, and it's a total game-changer. From Gaana to Spotify to Apple Music, the choices are endless. I mean, you can literally listen to *every* song ever recorded (almost!).
normalised: Thankfully, those days are long gone. We live in the age of music streaming, and it's a total game-changer. From Gaana to Spotify to Apple Music, the choices are endless. I mean, you can literally listen to *every* song ever recorded (almost!).

unnormalised: The best part? It’s so convenient. Imagine you're stuck in Delhi traffic, crawling along at 10 km/hr. Instead of getting road rage, you can just plug in your earphones and lose yourself in the latest Arijit Singh ballad or rediscover some old Kishore Kumar classics. Seriously, traffic jams become almost…bearable. Almost.
normalised: The best part? It’s so convenient. Imagine you're stuck in Delhi traffic, crawling along at ten kilometer per hour. Instead of getting road rage, you can just plug in your earphones and lose yourself in the latest Arijit Singh ballad or rediscover some old Kishore Kumar classics. Seriously, traffic jams become almost…bearable. Almost.

unnormalised: And it's not just about the convenience. Streaming services have also made discovering new music so much easier. Remember that time when your friend from IIT Kanpur introduced you to some amazing indie band you'd never heard of? Well, now algorithms do that for you (sometimes even better!). They curate playlists based on your listening habits, recommending artists and genres you might actually enjoy.

unnormalised: Speaking of Bollywood, remember that scene in *Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge* where Raj serenades Simran with "Tujhe Dekha Toh Yeh Jaana Sanam"? Well, now you can listen to that song on repeat, anytime, anywhere, without wearing out your cassette tape! No more scratchy playback!

unnormalised: Of course, there's the whole debate about artists getting fairly compensated (which is a very real issue, folks!). But the sheer accessibility and variety offered by music streaming services are undeniable.
normalised: Of course, there's the whole debate about artists getting fairly compensated (which is a very real issue, folks!). But the sheer accessibility and variety offered by music streaming services are undeniable.

unnormalised: Plus, many services offer free tiers (with ads, of course). So, if you're on a budget (like most of us!), you can still enjoy a massive library of music without spending a single Rupee.
normalised: Plus, many services offer free tiers (with ads, of course). So, if you're on a budget (like most of us!), you can still enjoy a massive library of music without spending a single Rupee.

unnormalised: So, ditch the dusty CDs, embrace the future, and get streaming! You won't regret it. Happy listening, mere dost!
